intro: Microlicia parvifolia var. viscosa, commonly known as the sticky microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in a fine, sticky pubescence. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique texture and appearance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
